parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To commit adultery (of a man with a married woman, but also of a married man). From moichos; to commit adultery.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To murder, kill. From phoneus; to be a murderer.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To steal. A primary verb; to filch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To testify falsely, bear false witness. From pseudomartur; to be an untrue testifier, i.e. Offer falsehood in evidence.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From timios; to prize, i.e. Fix a valuation upon; by implication, to revere.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
